summary: This bill, the Sgt. Isaac Woodard, Jr. and Sgt. Joseph H. Maddox GI Bill Restoration Act of 2025, aims to address historical racial discrimination in the administration of the GI Bill. It extends eligibility for housing loans and educational assistance to Black veterans of World War II, their surviving spouses, and certain descendants. The bill also mandates reports to Congress on the impact of these changes and establishes a Blue Ribbon panel to examine inequities in benefit distribution for female and minority veterans.
